oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A comprehensive model was developed to simulate Lactobacillus rhamnosus growth on a medium containing multiple limiting carbon sources. The strategy of optimizing specific growth rate to predict growth on multiple substrates was demonstrated. The model predictions were based on parameters obtained from L. rhamnosus growth on individual substrates. The model was able to simulate the growth, substrate consumption, product formation and specific growth rate profiles of L. rhamnosus accurately. The model prediction that co-metabolism of glucose and pyruvate enhances growth rate of and flavor production by the bacterium was experimentally verified.
